summaries.body: Thabo Sefolosha, the N.B.A. player, refused a lenient plea deal to resolve charges arising from a scuffle with the New York police in April. “He’s innocent," his lawyer explained.
Israel reopened an embassy in Cairo, four years to the day after the previous embassy was stormed by demonstrators during the aftermath of a popular uprising.

display_asset.caption: Activists produced a makeup tutorial video, starring Reshma Quereshi, to bring attention to the issue of acid attacks in India.

summaries.body: A campaign to limit the sale of acid in India has been energized by a powerful viral video of an acid attack survivor offering tips on how to apply lipstick.

display_asset.credit: Steve Gottlieb, via the Apollo Theater

summaries.body: The Apollo says it will be the first theater in the U.S. to offer an extended set of hologram performances. The first performer will be the singer Billie Holiday.
With a new school year starting, time management helps children avoid getting overwhelmed by too much activity. One way is to have them keep a time log for a week.
Reaction to the release of Kim Davis, who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, has ranged from the political stage to debate over religious beliefs.

asset.embed_html: <iframe class="embedly-embed" src="//cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FRNCrs63JeuM%3Ffeature%3Doembed&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DRNCrs63JeuM&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2FRNCrs63JeuM%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=170aca4a25074a88942b11f27e7ca43f&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" width="854" height="480" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

summaries.body: A Texas group that oversees school activities held a hearing Wednesday on two high school football players tackling a referee in a video that went viral, above.

display_asset.caption: Untitled in New York is one of the restaurants attempting to combat noise issues.
display_asset.credit: Pablo Enriquez for The New York Times

summaries.body: Why are New York restaurants so loud? An article on noise levels inspired comments about the din and theories as to why dining rooms have become so noisy.

display_asset.caption: Andris Nelsons.
display_asset.credit: Hiroyuki Ito for The New York Times

summaries.body: Andris Nelsons, the dynamic young conductor who became music director of the Boston Symphony last season will also be music director of the venerable Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra, a highly unusual move.
Hillary Clinton defended the Iran deal in a speech at the Brookings Institution in Washington and vowed to take military action if Iran attempts to obtain a nuclear weapon.

display_asset.caption: Queen Elizabeth II rode on a steam train in Scotland on Wednesday. She has been ruling for 63 years, seven months and two days, surpassing Queen Victoria, her great-great grandmother.

summaries.body: As of today, Queen Elizabeth II has become Britain’s longest-serving monarch, surpassing her great-great grandmother, Victoria. And not everyone is happy about it.
Insurgents led by Al Qaeda's affiliate in Syria captured a northwestern army air base on Wednesday after a two-year siege, state news media and an activist group said.

display_asset.caption: An employee of a private television channel associated with Hungary’s far-right Jobbik party was filmed kicking migrants and tripping a man carrying a child. She was fired on Tuesday.
keywords: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
display_asset.title: Camerawoman Kicks Migrants in Hungary

summaries.body: A video of a camerawoman in Hungary kicking migrants and tripping a man carrying a child went viral. She was fired on Tuesday.

display_asset.caption: President Obama boarding Air Force One last week for a trip to Anchorage.

summaries.body: President Obama will kick off a public-relations campaign today to make college more affordable with an event near Detroit. He wants to increase pressure on Congress.
Russia confirmed it has military advisers in Syria, but the Foreign Ministry said the presence of the specialists was part of a longstanding accord with Damascus.
Pilots at the German airline Lufthansa started a second day of strikes, grounding around 1,000 flights and affecting 140,000 passengers.
Brad Anderson, the cartoonist who created “Marmaduke,” a widely syndicated comic about a mischievous but lovable Great Dane, has died.
Thousands of members of Japan's largest organized-crime group, the Yamaguchi-gumi, have formed a new gang, prompting fears of a violent conflict.
The United States has opened a diplomatic mission for Somalia, which will be operated out of the American Embassy in Nairobi, Kenya.
An engine on a British Airways jet caught fire during takeoff from Las Vegas, injuring seven passengers and disrupting air travel in the West.
The N.B.A. Board of Governors voted to seed playoff teams based solely on their regular-season records, effectively removing the importance of division titles.
A Guatemalan judge ordered former President Otto Pérez Molina to stand trial on charges of bribery, customs fraud and conspiracy, and returned him to detention.
Queen Elizabeth II, 89, has become the longest-reigning monarch in Britain's history, surpassing her great-great-grandmother, Queen Victoria.
Nearly 8,000 people have died in the Ukrainian conflict, the U.N. said in a report citing the continuing influx of fighters and weaponry from Russia. Above, pro-Russian rebels.
Kansas State suspended its marching band director after a controversial halftime show at a football game over the weekend.

display_asset.caption: Roger Goodell, the commissioner of the N.F.L, leaving federal court on Aug. 12.

summaries.body: After several legal defeats, Roger Goodell, the commissioner of the N.F.L., said he would be open to changing his role in governing the league’s personal conduct policy.
Vicki Gardner, right, has been released from the hospital. She was injured when Alison Parker, left, and another journalist were fatally shot on air in Virginia last month.
The World Cup qualifier between Malaysia and Saudi Arabia was abandoned in the 87th minute after fans launched flares and fireworks onto the field, local news media said.

display_asset.caption: The dismissal of Austin Buetner as publisher of The Los Angeles Times comes amid internal dissent between the paper and its parent company, Tribune Publishing.
display_asset.credit: Kirk Mckoy/Los Angeles Times, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The publisher of The Los Angeles Times is being fired after opposing corporate direction from its parent company, Tribune Publishing.
The British crooner Sam Smith announced that he will sing the theme for "Spectre," the next James Bond movie.
